title: Riki Papakura
text:
Riki "Dick" Papakura was a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> player who represented the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Māori</a> side and Australasia and played professionally for <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a>. His position of preference was at fullback or in the centres.
Playing career.
From <a href="Rotorua">Rotorua</a>, Papakura toured Australia twice with the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Māori</a> side; in 1908 with the original touring party and again as captain of the 1909 <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Māori</a> side, he also represented <a href="Australasia%20rugby%20league%20team">Australasia</a>.
In 1909 Papakura played for <a href="Bay%20of%20Plenty%20rugby%20league%20team">Rotorua</a> against an Auckland XIII before playing for <a href="Auckland%20rugby%20league%20team">Auckland</a> against <a href="Wellington%20rugby%20league%20team">Wellington</a>.
In 1910 Papakura was one of three New Zealanders invited to Sydney to represent Australasia against the <a href="1910%20Great%20Britain%20Lions%20tour%20of%20Australia%20and%20New%20Zealand">touring Great Britain Lions</a>, alongside <a href="Albert%20Asher">Albert Asher</a> and <a href="Con%20Sullivan">Con Sullivan</a>. Papakura played in both "Test" matches at fullback.
In 1911 Papakura travelled to England to attend the <a href="Festival%20of%20Empire">Festival of Empire</a>. He was recommended to <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> by 1910 Lion <a href="Frank%20Shugars">Frank Shugars</a> and 1908 All Gold <a href="Massa%20Johnston">Massa Johnston</a> and joined the club in September. He twice appeared for Warrington A but gave the impression of being overweight and unfit.
Papakura played centre for Warrington's first grade team on 14 October 1911 in a 13–8 win over <a href="Broughton%20Rangers">Broughton Rangers</a> at <a href="Wilderspool%20Stadium">Wilderspool Stadium</a>. This match was part of the <a href="1911%E2%80%9312%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1911–12 Northern Rugby Football Union season</a>. Papakura was New Zealand's first overseas transfer, as he was granted a clearance by the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Rugby%20League">New Zealand Rugby League</a> on 6 October and <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> paid a 20-pound fee that was forwarded to the Rotorua sub-league.
After his one and only first grade appearance, Papakura was again named in the Warrington A side. However, he realised he had failed to secure a place in the Warrington first grade team and so he returned to the Festival of Empire in London.
